resources.string: Gives access to files stored on the device
This may require root-right and can cause the resource-group to crash.
Allows the application to read every file stored on the device.
Allows the application to write files everywhere on the device.
Allows the application to receive a list of all files stored in every directory of on the device.
Allows the application to delete every file stored on the device.
Allows the application to create directories everywhere on the device.
If this is enabled, privacy-levels for sub-directories (like "music") will be ignored.
Allows the application to read every files stored in the external directory.
Allows the application to write files everywhere in the external directory.
Allows the application to receive a list of all files stored in the external directory.
Allows the application to delete every file stored in the external directory.
Allows the application to create directories everywhere in the external directory.
Allows the application to read files stored in the external {dir} directory.
Allows the application to write files in the external {dir} directory.
Allows the application to list all files and directories in the external {dir} directory.
Allows the application to delete files and directories stored in the external {dir} directory.
Allows the application to create new directories in the external {dir} directory.
